name: Canola Tenderfoot - Hy-Brasil (CD)
description:
This item comes with a free digital copy of the album.

Way back in the mists of time at the turn of the century, before the creation of Slime Recordings, we were introduced to the music of a band called Canola Tenderfoot. The duo – husband and wife Owen and Vik Shirley – created sublime soundscapes that were complemented by Vik’s breathless vocal delivery. In 2007 their debut album “Winning Is For Losers” was released on Malicious Damage and it’s fair to say the sound of that album directly influenced the formation of our own little imprint, and the melodic aesthetic that we continue to champion to this day.

In the early days of the label we made a commitment to the band that if at any stage they were ready to release more music, we’d love for them to become a part of our family. That commitment has been carried through to this year, where we are proud to announce the release of their sophomore effort ‘Hy-Brasil’, a truly beautiful set of songs that will soothe your soul.

‘Hy-Brasil’ refers to a phantom island which was said to lie in the Atlantic Ocean, west of Ireland. An expedition to find the island was once launched from the band's hometown of Bristol. The band felt a connection to this journey - setting out to unknown territories when making the record. The ethereal nature of memory and time that permeates this myth runs through the album, played out in plaintive melodies and melancholy voices. 

The album opens submerged in the echoes of the past, as hazy rhythms entwine laconic vocals to create a hypnotic effect on the listener. Layers of melody unfurl across minimal percussion before blossoming into an overwhelming wall of sound. With each track the album progresses into stranger, darker territories before your mental moorings finally break and leave you afloat in a blissful ocean of sound. Canola Tenderfoot’s sound is as timeless as the myths they embrace – a hidden gem suffused with a grace and eloquence that is something to be treasured.  

Tracklisting:

01.Setting Sail For Hy-Brasil
02.Eleanor's Elegy
03.Fade
04.Histories
05.I'm Not Sinking
06.Token
07.Semper Victrix
08.Rebel Angel
09.Karolijn
10.Lock Out
11.No Pasaran!

name: Vausz - Maru-So
description:
Vausz returns to the label after the success of his debut album, ‘Bosozoku’. Conceived as a companion piece to that incredible document of the golden age of rave music, ‘Maru-Sō‘ follows on with four incendiary tracks that merge the heritage of electronic music into something altogether new and wonderful. 

‘Basstime’ thunders into being with cavernous drums and a bassline so gargantuan it will rattle your ribcage. Sci-Fi chords glisten under the hood, propelling the track forward with a sense of the cinematic, full of foreboding and dread.

‘Circle Jerk’ envelops your brain stem with an insistent acidic groove, undulating into infinity with the singular purpose of making you move. Faint strands of mournful chords add an air of melancholy to proceedings as the percussion builds up into a gargantuan jacking rhythm.

‘Calliste’ straps you in tight for a ride to the darkside with a body-popping electro groove and snapping percussion. Throwback melodies drop in and out of the mix to amplify the feeling you are trapped in an arcade machine somewhere around 1983.

‘Boomhaur’ starts off with what sounds like a planet being unwillingly terraformed then descends into a relentless techno assault. Stark percussion overlays ominous rave stabs before unfurling into an acidic wig-out for the final furlong.  

Tracklisting:

1. Basstime
2. Circle Jerk
3. Calliste
4. Boomhaur

name: Neue Grafik - Glasgow
description:
Neue Grafik returns to the label after his incendiary debut ‘Verdana’. The Parisian producer has been on a roll recently, working with the legendary Grems and tearing up sets at the hottest parties around France. Since completing his inaugural release for Slime, he’s also been hard at work in the lab cooking up some new beats for us – and he doesn’t disappoint with his sophomore effort, ‘Glasgow’. The acrobatic percussive style of the former has been refined into an exhilarating showcase of rhythm and melody that has no equal.

‘Glasgow’ sparks into life with a disjointed groove that slowly unfolds into a dark tropical roller, soulful vocals woven into glittering melodies and kinetic percussion. The track snaps back and forth into hyperactive interludes of pressurised beats per minute for an energising ride to the dark side.

‘Ideal’ drifts into existence built around a mournful chord progression, strapped to a slow motion R&B jam that is infused with a cinematic foreboding. Vocals are strewn across the mix like depth charges as the dramatic synth work elevates the track into something truly mesmerising. 

‘Whitney’ takes a foot off the accelerator for a low-slung number that exudes sensuality through every smooth pore of its structure. Languorous vocals permeate the mix as a narcotic funk groove pops and snaps through unexpected turns that jump start your synapses.

On the remix tip, up and coming London-based producer Lion Gonzalez toughens up the lead track with a heavyweight half-step, complete with fizzing atmospherics and sparkling keys. Fellow Parisian and labelmate Hybu steps up with a beautiful mutation of a track from Neue Grafik’s previous release, turning ‘Bauhaus’ into a stone-cold house classic, perfect for all discerning warehouses worldwide. 

Tracklisting:

1. Glasgow
2. Ideal
3. Whitney
4. Glasgow (Lion Gonzalez Mix)
5. Bauhaus (Hybu Mix)

name: Blem - I'm Ready
description:
Slime welcomes to the label Spanish duo Blem. Formed by Broken Lip from BSN Posse and fellow producer Energy Man, the pair combine cutting-edge beats with a melodic flourish for a fresh style that is pure sunshine. For their debut release on the imprint they deliver a beautiful set of tracks, backed up with some killer remixes from the extended Slime family.

‘I’m Ready’ is built around a mournful sequence of chords moored to a bouncing garage beat. Soulful vocals add some weight to proceedings as the melody builds up into a heady brew of emotion. The track continually shifts forward with imperceptible sonic additions that keep your ears busy all the way.

‘Free’ glides in on soft chords and bubbling percussion before unfurling into a gorgeous mix of shimmering atmospherics and shuffling beats. Saccharine vocals are liberally sprinkled on top to give the track a sweetness that keeps you coming back for repeat play.

On the digital flip, the lead track is taken to task by labelmate Kontigo, who deconstructs it into a half-step groove that gives the elements of the original acres of space to breathe. Swedish producer Totte takes on ‘Free’, twisting it into a full-on floor filler, replete with rave stabs, rolling beats and a mutated bassline that will begs for the wheel up.

Tracklisting:

1. I’m Ready
2. Free
3. I’m Ready (Kontigo Mix)
4. Free (Totte Mix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F12452733&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F12452733&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Sleezy - Shaolin
description:
Finnish producer Sleezy returns to Slime after his incendiary debut for the label last year. Bringing the bounce back that he applied to ‘Comin’ Back’, he comes correct again with a brace of killer dancefloor cuts that strip things down to the basics with a simple hook and a speaker-popping kickdrum.

‘Shaolin’ gets straight to the point with a driving four to the floor, strapped to a looping melody. Shuffling percussion is dropped in on top to give proceedings some serious swing, and here less is most definitely more as the track rides the rhythm all the way.

‘Curious’ takes things a little darker, with a skittering beat and echoing vocal snippets sprinkled over a seriously heavy bassline that will keep feet on the floor long after the lights go up.

Tracklisting:

1. Shaolin
2. Curious

name: DYP - Torn
description:
Slime Recordings heads to Denmark by way of Australia to welcome DYP back to the label. The recently re-located antipodean producer has been hard at work crafting beats since his debut on the imprint with ‘Vices’. Having further refined his formula of silky smooth melodies across intricate percussive patterns,  here he presents four cuts that are charged full of emotion and beauty.

‘Torn’ drifts in on plaintive chords and mournful atmospherics before dropping into bubbling percussion and cavernous sub-bass that adds some serious weight to the track. Glittering keys flicker over the surface with the lightest of touches, delivering a beguiling sense of melody.

‘Vivid’ picks up the pace with a skittering percussive layer woven into a rising tide of chords. The beat rolls into a deadly piano hook that lifts this track up to the next level.

‘Softly’ warms the vibe up nicely with a late night sultry house jam, sparkling keys and vocals working the mix all the way down into your heart and soul. Pure audio goodness.

‘Monoform’ strips things back with a skeletal beat and faint chords interspersing soft female vocals across a rolling bassline for some no-nonsense, heads-down 4am dancefloor action.

Tracklisting:

1.Torn
2.Vivid
3.Softly
4.Monoform

name: Clima - Today
description:
Slime Recordings heads to Spain to welcome new recruits Clima to the label. Having already established themselves with an impressive collection of releases across a variety of imprints, the duo’s style traverses D&B, dubstep, garage and more with ease. A flair for melody is bolted to intricate drum patterns to produce a sound that is pure sunshine.

‘Hombres Que Avanzan’ drifts in on hazy atmospherics and ethereal keys before sweeping into a laidback half-step. Subdued female vocals float through the framework of the track as it quickly transports you into a dream-like state.

‘Today’ continues the horizontal vibes of the former track with soulful vocals and warm pads that are shot through with a sense of late nights drenched in summer sun. Sparkling percussion keeps the mood bubbling throughout as the rhythm takes over your soul.

‘Tell Me One’ straps staccato vocal stabs to a snap beat whilst glittering keys spiral up around them. Soft chords shimmer in the distance as the bassline snakes in and out of the mix. 

‘Black Eyes & Sweat’ takes proceedings up a notch with a tropical tempo and shuffling percussion. Playful keys keep the tone light and breezy whilst swirling atmospherics envelop the track.

Tracklisting:

1.Hombres Que Avanzan
2.Today
3.Tell Me One
4.Black Eyes & Sweat

name: Pledge - Alright
description:
Slime Recordings welcomes Pledge back to the label after his previous release ‘Waiting’ entranced fans of deep dance music. Fresh from a prolonged spell in the lab cooking up some new beats, he returns with his new single ‘Alright’, following a similar template of melodic flair.

‘Alright’ slowly moves into focus out of a mist of hazy atmospherics and submerged vocals before a bubbling percussion loop adds momentum to the track. Mournful chords and sweeping melodies sparkle across the surface whilst the bassline expands across playful keys.

On the digital flip, fellow label mate Akin re-constructs the original into a sparse meditation, with spacious chords harnessed on the back of a narcotic half-step rhythm. Australian producer DYP offers up an altogether more up-tempo take on the original, with a tropical house flavour full of bumpy four to the floor action and soft keys.

Tracklisting:

1.Alright (Original Mix)
2.Alright (Akin Mix)
3.Alright (DYP Mix)

name: Retrospekt - This Ain't Disco
description:
Slime Recordings welcomes back Retrospekt to the label. With two killer singles under his belt in ‘Rolling’ and ‘Popularity’, the London producer has perfected a unique take on house music with a narcotic slow-motion feel that extrapolates the energy of the traditional four to the floor and twists it into something fresh and vital. Returning with the agenda-setting ‘This Ain’t Disco’ he has stepped his techniques up a notch to deliver a true dancefloor thriller.

‘This Ain’t Disco’ sticks to the title’s statement throughout – it ain’t disco that’s for sure. What it is instead is a throbbing monster of a track, alternating through pulsating drums and a mammoth bassline into sparkling melodies and spaced-out chords. One thing is for sure though – it’s a guaranteed floor filler.

‘Anyway’ sees Retrospekt team up with Polish producer Platkovksky for an altogether lighter affair, with soft pads and rolling percussion sweeping across staccato vocals and bass stabs. A perfect accompaniment to hazy nights in neon-soaked cities.

Tracklisting:

1.This Ain’t Disco
2.Anyway (feat. Platkovksky)

name: Materia - Atlas Remixed
description:
Slime Recordings reached a new milestone this year with the launch of its first physical release – the debut album from Swedish producer Materia. ‘Atlas’ was the result - an album that extrapolates the fundamentals of house, garage, dubstep and techno - then fuses them into a listening experience full of warmth and texture which reveals further depths through every repeated play. The album garnered a lot of accolades, with Igloo Magazine calling it “a genuine work of substance” and Electronic Music Magazine describing it as “immensely satisfying”.

To celebrate the success of the release, Slime has commissioned six producers to remix some of the key tracks on the album. The result is an intriguing selection from some of the most creative underground producers working today.

First up we welcome Submerse back to the label. One of the most talented producers around, here he develops on the sound he has been cultivating on his Project:Mooncircle releases with a slow motion version of the lead track from the album, ‘Otherland’. Extrapolating all the original elements of the track and twisting them into something completely new and refreshing, it’s clear to see why he is so highly regarded as an artist.

‘Otherland’ is taken into another direction by the legendary drum & bass producer Macc, who we have managed to coax out of retirement to tackle this remix. The original’s ethereal qualities are kept intact, but infused with truly astounding drum work and delicate melodies reconstructed with pin-sharp clarity for a mix that is truly special.

For the final remix of the lead track, Dublin-based producer Genetix twists the original into a shuffling deep dubstep roller replete with sparkling synths and cavernous low-end that will rattle chests and elevate minds.

Next up, Bristol-based producer Lojik takes on ‘Clouds’. One of the stand-out tracks from the original release, it’s staccato downbeat rhythm is finessed into a bass-heavy groove with superb bars from Bristol MC Koast driving the beat forward alongside the sublime vocals of New York vocalist Winter.

Swedish producer Petter B takes on the closing track from the album, ‘Synthesis’. The Drumcode artist manipulates the spaced-out style of the original into a rolling techno stomper where sparkling melodies are strapped to a heavy-duty groove with devastating results.

Completing the set Bristol-based producer Discord takes ‘Synthesis’ into altogether darker territory with a throbbing techno jam complete with acidic licks and snapping percussion that continually builds until the dancefloor will be in a frenzy.

Tracklisting:

1.Otherland (Submerse Mix)
2.Otherland (Macc Mix)
3.Otherland (Genetix Mix)
4.Clouds (Lojik Mix)
5.Synthesis (Petter B Mix)
6.Synthesis (Discord Mix)

name: Aaron Static - I Won't
description:
Australian producer Aaron Static returns to Slime after his previous release ‘Reflections’ on the imprint showcased his incredible flair for melody across a wide spectrum of genres. Since then he’s dropped his debut album ‘Redemption’ on native label This Is For You, and has been increasing his already considerable following with his sought-after bootlegs and mixes. For his sophomore effort with Slime he delivers two cuts that have become firm fan favourites already.

'I Won’t' sweeps in on a plaintive piano groove, wrapped around a gossamer percussive lilt that builds and builds into a truly beautiful garage roller. Mournful vocals and subtle keys add texture to the rhythm as the bassline adds pure warmth to proceedings.

'Take Me' takes an even more atmospheric route to you heart, with bubbling synths and ethereal vocals drenched over skeletal drums and a subterranean bassline with a refined subtlety that draws you in deeper and deeper.

Tracklisting:

1.I Won’t
2.Take Me

name: Various - We Will Riot OST (CD)
description:
Slime is proud to announce its partnership with Naratyvas to present the official soundtrack to the original motion picture We Will Riot.

We Will Riot is a film about love, friendship, beats – and the system that destroys it all. The film has been creating a buzz since launching at the Moscow Film Festival earlier in the year, having been highlighted by Hollywood Reporter amongst others. The debut feature directed by Romas Zabarauskas continues to be showcased at film festivals across the world and is due for release on DVD soon.

The soundtrack features 25 tracks from the underground Lithuanian music scene, covering a wide variety of styles curated by music supervisor Mark Splinter, ranging from ambient to dubstep, electronica to techno and beyond. Established artists such as the Pitchfork-endorsed Eleven Tigers rub shoulders with young upstarts like the 17-year old Justicious for a fascinating snapshot of a music scene brimming with creativity and flair.

This enhanced CD includes the full OST plus special features, videos and photos.

name: Various - We Will Riot OST (Digital)
description:
Slime is proud to announce its partnership with Naratyvas to present the official soundtrack to the original motion picture We Will Riot.

We Will Riot is a film about love, friendship, beats – and the system that destroys it all. The film has been creating a buzz since launching at the Moscow Film Festival earlier in the year, having been highlighted by Hollywood Reporter amongst others. The debut feature directed by Romas Zabarauskas continues to be showcased at film festivals across the world and is due for release on DVD soon.

The soundtrack features 25 tracks from the underground Lithuanian music scene, covering a wide variety of styles curated by music supervisor Mark Splinter, ranging from ambient to dubstep, electronica to techno and beyond. Established artists such as the Pitchfork-endorsed Eleven Tigers rub shoulders with young upstarts like the 17-year old Justicious for a fascinating snapshot of a music scene brimming with creativity and flair.

name: Mr Beeb & Fault Lines - Take You Away
description:
Slime welcomes Scottish producer Mr.Beeb for his first full run out on the label. Joining forces with Glaswegian producer Fault Lines for this release, both artists demonstrate the skills that have won them many admirers in the underground scene over the past year.

'Take You Away' combines saccharine vocals and rolling percussion across an undulating bassline with a smooth tropical edge for some tasty garage action. File this one under waist winding ammunition strictly for the dancefloor.

On the flip, Norwegian producer Clueless toughens up the drums and brings the warehouse vibes direct to your door with rave stabs, relentless grooves and swirling melodies for a slice of peak-time party action.

Tracklisting:

1.Take You Away 
2.Take You Away (Clueless Mix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8908491&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8908491&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Sker - The Tide
description:
Slime welcomes back to the label Cardiff producer Sker. Debuting on the imprint with the beautiful 'Sunrise' last year, he's been hard at work perfecting his sound into the crystalline textures that form his sophomore effort 'The Tide'. Fusing dubstep, autonomic and electronica into one heady brew, Sker had developed a sound unique to himself.

'44' drifts into view with misty chords and bubbling atmospherics, giving way to mournful strings and surface noise. Sharp percussion adds the backbone to the groove as it develops into a smooth summertime roller.

'Again' drops back on the tempo with melodic keys and wistful vocals scattered in the mix. Packed to the brim with warmth and character the track builds relentlessly, taking the listener horizontal with it as it goes.

'The Tide' toughens up with a harder rhythm and hypnotic beats. Subtle melodies intersperse the mix as the bassline locks in the groove and drives the track forward.

For the finale, London producer Barefoot extrapolates the best elements of the former track and straps it to a bubbling tropical house beat, fizzling percussion and undulating bass expanding out the core into something of a future classic.

Tracklisting:

1.44
2.Again
3.The Tide
4.The Tide (Barefoot Mix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8745801&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8745801&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Fortay - Clouded Sounds
description:
Coming to us from Bristol by way of London, Slime welcomes aboard the talented new producer Fortay. Having built up a reputation on a series of killer bootlegs, he comes to the label with a brace of incredible tracks that straddle the line between house and garage, adding some tropical flavour and bags of personality.

'Clouded Sounds' sets the standard early with a joyful percussive roller. Soft vocals sink into the mix as playful claps and modulated bass drive the track along with an air of mischief.

'I Want You With Me' adds some spice to the template of the former track with swirling pads and lush melodies, before dropping into a seriously killer bassline and beat workout that will be raising the temperature on dancefloors across the world.

'Long Weekend' combines soulful keys and a bumpy house groove before descending into a throwdown of beats and bleeps that has all the hallmarks of a heads-down, lights-up end of the night roller.

On the final track, up and coming producer Hugo takes the previous beat to task with a darker twist on the original, staccato bass stabs and creaking vocal FX shaping it into a warehouse killer if ever we heard one.

Tracklisting:

1.Clouded Sounds
2.I Want You With Me
3.Long Weekend (feat. Grant Alexander)
4.Long Weekend (Hugo Remix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8281758&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8281758&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Blaike - Blaike
description:
Slime welcomes to the label London producer Blaike. Mixing up house, techno and garage with considerable flair, his style is aimed squarely at the dancefloor and designed to wind your waist. For his debut on the imprint he delivers three impeccable bass music hybrids destined to be working crowds across the rest of the year.

'Tribe' comes correct with a carnival rhythm across a playful groove, chopped vocals interspersed in the mix to add some bounce to proceedings.

'Never Easy' drops some serious atomospherics on a rolling house beat, with soulful female vocals rubbing up against warm pads and a laconic bassline, perfect for hazy summer nights.

'BITG' rolls in on sprightly keys and percussion strapped to a joyous four to the floor for maximum effect in the club, with the track building relentlessly until you have to succumb to it's charms.

Tracklisting:

1.Tribe
2.Never Easy
3.BITG

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8281143&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8281143&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Colorhythm - Azure
description:
Slime warmly welcomes back Russian producer Colorhythm to the label. Since his debut on the imprint with 'Palette', he has been refining his sound into something even more sensual than his last effort. For his return, he delivers a brace of laidback classics in the making.

'Azure' drifts into view like early morning sunlight through rain-soaked trees. Chords glide in and fuse against a hazy breakbeat whilst melodies flutter around the mix, transporting you to lazy summer days drenched in heat.

'NRG' plays with the more traditional elements of rave music, extrapolating a euphoric chord sequences and mixing it with a skittering half-step rhythm for maximum impact. 

'Charm' takes the tempo down a few notches for a sublime slice of laidback dubstep. Shot through with an R&B sensibility, this has a rich personality all it's own. A perfect partner for sipping that long cool drink with on those hot neon-soaked city nights.

Labelmates BSN Posse and Akin take the lead track apart and deliver some stellar results; BSN Posse strips it back into a slow tropical jam with a distinctly 80s flavour, percussion percolating in the background as the melodies bloom into full view. Akin delivers two takes, with the first a beautiful autonomic odyssey and the second a sublime journey into blissed-out electronica.

Tracklisting:

1.Azure
2.NRG
3.Charm
4.Azure (BSN Posse Remix)
5.Azure (Akin Remix)
6.Azure (Akin Abstract Remix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8072599&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8072599&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Twofold - Feat
description:
Slime welcomes London producer Twofold to the label. Having made a name for himself with a sound that harks back to the golden era of garage but with its feet firmly in the future, he comes to the imprint with strong support from Radio 1 and Rinse FM amongst others. For his debut, he rolls out the dancefloor firepower with four killer cuts destined to be firm favourites with clubbers for some time.

'Feat' kicks things off in style with a thundering garage rhythm, packed full of energy and guaranteed to fill any floor in seconds. Skittering percussion bubbles over echoing bleeps before the undulating bassline slides in and the situation gets serious.

'Fangs' takes the toughness of the former track and straps it to soulful vocal cuts and scaling keys for maximum dancefloor impact. Midnight melodies are drenched over the top for added effect to make this a future classic.

'Just Stay Around' hits the ground running with a searing vocal and swirling atmospherics before launching into a blistering four to the floor thriller. As the elements combine perfectly, it will be impossible not to wind your waist to the relentless beat.

For the final track, up and coming producer Circula takes Feat apart and reconstructs it into a deeper take on the original, as spacious beats and bass mix it up with glittering FX and disembodied keys filtering through the track for a ride to the darkside.

Tracklisting:

1. Feat 
2. Fangs 
3. Just Stay Around 
4. Feat (Circula Remix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7954919&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7954919&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Jeeroj - Midnight Resistance
description:
Way back in the mists of time, Slime was approached by the mysterious producer Jeeroj, whose unique take on acid was a revelation for us. Invested with emotion, humour and personality, his music was light years away from our usual output but we simply couldn't resist his charms.

The resulting love affair brought 'Selected Acid Works' into reality, his debut long player for the label and the culmination of many years worth of time spent honing his sound in sweaty bedrooms and dark basements. Fast forward to this year, and Jeeroj is back with his sophomore effort 'Midnight Resistance', and the question is always the same – how do you follow up something that took ten years to make?

The answer is simple. Extract the formula and expand it into brand new galaxies of sound. 'Midnight Resistance' takes all of the charm of the former release and catapults it through brave new worlds – touching on italo disco, jungle, house, breakbeat, techno and of course lashings of acid. It shows a satisfying evolution to his sound and holds a promise for what's to come in the future.

'Midnight Resistance' sounds like the soundtrack to some long-lost giallo masterpiece, ice-cold electro beats, slap-funk bass and marauding keys the companion to a scene of some leather-trousered maverick driving his roadster recklessly through neon-slicked city streets.

'Sunday Drive' shuffles and undulates into being with a cavernous acid squiggle creating the sonic tentacle that slowly penetrates your cerebellum and squeezes your brain dry.

'Sproket' drifts in on a haze of bucolic melodies, building up into an exhilirating labryinth of jungle rhythms that short circuits your brain back to it's pagan roots and will have you burning effigies of the old gods in next to no time.

'Take My Pocket' sounds like the official anthem of the Nation of Cthulu, and rest assured when they awaken from their thousand years sleep and dredge themselves from the bottom of the sea this will be playing as they eat our souls.

'Ambient Seagull' creates a warm ocean of sound in your mind, lapping up against your amygdala with profound results.

'Could It Get Any Worse' takes the husk of Human League, stretches it to snapping point and then launches it into the heart of the sun. The resulting supernova shines radiation down on our faces as we look to the heavens whilst the sky burns.

'Doubletto' straps a panic alarm of a kick drum to echoing atmospherics, inducing paranoia and jubilation in equal amounts within all those who hear it.

'CSRD XVII' sounds just about as close to an anthem as you can get, if your idea of an anthem is a bottom-heavy acid freakout strapped to warehouse-grade rave music.

'Mincely' sparkles with glittering keys and low rolling bass stabs before unfurling in the final furlong with a glorious jungle rinseout.

'Space Lounge' brings proceedings to a close with laconic pads wrapped around a bouncing kick drum, spiked through the centre with melancholy acid lines, tweaks and bleeps. 

Tracklisting:

01.Midnight Resistance
02.Sunday Drive
03.Sproket
04.Take My Pocket
05.Ambient Seagull
06.Could It Get Any Worse
07.Doubletto
08.CSRD XVII
09.Mincely
10.Space Lounge

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8392059&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F8392059&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: OTTO - Movement
description:
Slime reaches it's 80th release, and with it welcomes to the label the mysterious producer O.T.T.O for a sublime odyssey into sensual house music. The style on display here is laidback and retro-fitted to some nebulous time in the mid-80s, showcasing a producer with a real flair for the cinematic in their music.

'Movement' rolls into life with breathless vocals and skittering drums, before warm pads drift in with a narcotic haziness. Melodic flourishes trigger false memories implanted in your brain of neon-soaked nocturnal escapades in some tropical paradise.

'Midnight'  takes an altogether bumpier percussive route, with garage drumwork creeping over echoing vocal snippets for a darker twist to the former track. Deep chords drop across the groove, massaging your eardrums into a lather.

For the final cut, talented producer Blaike throws down a masterful take on the title track, toughening up the drums and bassline for a supreme dancefloor classic in the making.

Tracklisting:

01.Movement
02.Midnight
03.Movement (Blaike Remix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7294355&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7294355&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Totte - The Mist Below
description:
Slime welcomes back to the label Swedish producer Totte, who since his debut on the imprint in 2012 with 'Restless', has gone on to become one of the rising stars of the global bass music scene thanks to his unique mix of melodic sensibilities strapped to party-starting breaks. Here he delivers a showcase in how his style has evolved over the past year, with a heady mix of guttural vocal samples, reinforced beats and sweeping synthesisers that will fill floors everywhere.

'Filter Drip' drifts in on a haze of swooning keys before dropping into a twin attack of crunchy drums and rolling bass. Baritone vocals duel a playful melody line across the surface to create an insistent dancefloor thriller.

'The Mist Below'  takes things down a notch with a decidely more laidback approach. Drums percolate in the background as a chopped vocals pour some soul over the top. Melancholy chords draw out the atmosphere before the bassline kicks in with maximum effect.

'ADSR' completes the set with a mischievous party anthem, spliced vocal stabs juxtaposed with spiky keys across a bumpy 2-step rhythm. Combine this with an exhilarating breakdown and you have a classic cut in the making.

Tracklisting:

01.Filter Drip
02.The Mist Below
03.ADSR

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7257990&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F7257990&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Soaka - Fume
description:
Welsh producer Soaka makes a welcome return to the label for another masterclass in minimal electronica. Since he dropped his well received 'All The While' EP on the imprint, Soaka has been hard at work honing his unique sound. Stripping back the already skeletal framework he used for his last release to give the beat space to breath at an almost unprecedented level, he delivers a haunting essay into the hinterland of dark ambience.

'Fume' sets the scene with an ethereal array of pads and keys interlocking to form an atmospheric opening sequence that compliments the proceeding tracks.

'Heat' creaks into existence on a uneven bed of fractured drums and drunken keys. Hazy vocals pour through the gaps to give proceedings a solemn, melancholy edge. Deceptively simple it might seem, but on a heavy system the kick alone will rupture ribcages.

'Circa' drifts in like mist across a dark land, glittering bleeps and narcotic melodies swept underneath with a creeping sense of foreboding. Saccharine vocals glisten in the midst of space between the beat, seperating your mind from the here and now for it's duration.

Tracklisting:

01.Fume
02.Heat
03.Circa

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F6803498&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F6803498&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Bodwan - VCVRS
description:
Slime heads to Italy for its next installment in forward-thinking electronic music. Bodwan makes his debut here for the imprint but is no stranger to the scene, having turned out a handful of impressive remixes for other artists in his trademark inventive style over the past year. Bringing together multiple strands from house, garage, dubstep and beyond, he creates a compelling new sound that is rich with texture and emotion.

'Above' drifts in on an ocean of soothing sounds, washing over a raft of percussive elements before the bassline rolls in and renders everything with a sun-blushed warmth. From here the song reaches shore, and wanders into a strange hinterland of haunting vocals and harmonies.

'Apart' extrapolates the melancholy of the former track and distills it through a much tougher framework. Beats crystallize to diamond against a solemn piano solo before taking the track to the other side, with you along for the ride.

'Someone (Makes You More)' brings a house rhythm to proceedings with startling effect, building layer after layer of vocals and melody across the span of the track with dizzying results. A perfect soundtrack to hazy summer nights drenched in heat and smoke.

Tracklisting:

01. Above
02. Apart
03.Someone (Makes You More)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F6613080&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F6613080&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Gyu - Sunblast
description:
Slime welcomes renowned bassweight alchemist Gyu to the label. Although hailing from the UK, Gyu has been residing in Russia for the past few years, churning out his trademark ice-cold beats on labels such as Urban Scrumping, Subgrade and Coral. Here he brings his precision-cut breakbeats to the fore with two superb slices of forward-thinking electronic music.

'Sunblast' is a super smooth hybrid of house, garage and dubstep that is built around a looping vocal and cavernous bassline. Glittering bleeps and glacial pads add to the atmosphere as the rhythm draws you deeper in.

'Non-Stop' raises the temperature with a subtle groove laid over tropical percussion and warm chords. Chopped vocals add the spice to this heady brew that will keep you moving until the early hours.

Tracklisting:

01. Sunblast
02. Non-Stop

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F6389082&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F6389082&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: SPD - Hazy
description:
SPD makes his welcome return to the label after a blistering start to the year with his highly-regarded sophomore release 'The Way We Live'. Here he builds on the raw, emotive power of that release by extrapolating the melodic essence of his previous work and pouring it into a harder, more focused style and sound.

'Hazy' is built around an undulating column of percussion, bubbling over a laconic dubstep rhythm. Vocals extolling the virtues of a certain herb only serve to strenghten the heavyweight flex of this beat.

'Slew' rolls in on eerie chords and bass stabs, before a narcotic house beat drops in to expand the sinister edge to this track. Clipped FX adds to the ominous atmospherics, leading you on a downward spiral into darkness.

'Aight' lightens the mood with a retro house cut that feels like a long-lost warehouse classic, soulful vocals and scattershot percussion drenched over a raw four to the floor. 

'4Tres' brings proceedings to a close with a widescreen feel – cinematic chords and rolling beats strapped to a chimeric bassline that builds up to a melodic crescendo.

Tracklisting:

01. Hazy
02. Slew
03. Aight
04. 4Tres

name: Threnody - Peak
description:
Slime welcomes established UK producer Threnody to the imprint. With a string of highly-regarded releases on labels such as Big Dada, Combat and Rottun to his name, Threnody has explored the parameters of bass music for many years, forging his own signature sound in the process.

'Peak' isn't named in vain. Spectral atmospherics roll over a shuddering percussive rhythm, all held up by a serpentine bassline snaking it's way up your spinal column. Warped sirens and baritone vocals add the final flourish, but really it was game over for any dancefloor from the first few bars.

Tomb Crew step in on the flip to bring the heat with a twisted remix that can only be a product of their equally twisted minds.  Racking up the tempo by several notches to deliver a  bumpy house cut that amplifies the raw energy of the original to new heights, they bring the vibes like no one else can.

Tracklisting:

01. Peak (Original Mix)
02. Peak (Tomb Crew Mix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F5914314&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F5914314&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Burnie - Atlantic
description:
Slime heads to Macau for it's next installment of future music, this time courtesy of up and coming producer Burnie. Moonlighting from his work in electronica outfit Evade, here he delivers three cuts of beautiful music full of sensuality and emotion.

'Atlantic' drifts into view like a summer breeze, all sun-blushed haze and dream-like chords, pinned to a framework of skittering percussion. Half-whispered vocals soar around the track like ghosts in the machine, adding to the mystery.

'Duke' brings the heat with a jacking groove straight out of Chicago circa 1986, deconstructed for  the future with ethereal vocal embellishments and off-kilter piano stabs.

'Future City Film Club' drops a relaxed 2-step shuffle over reverberating vocals and bubbling basslines. Shimmering chords glide along the surface as acid tweaks gently encase the track in a feeling of harmony.
 
Tracklisting:

01. Atlantic
02. Duke
03. Future City Film Club

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F5688385&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F5688385&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Made - Sanctum
description:
Slime welcomes back UK producer Made to the label. Debuting on the imprint with the well-regarded 'Forward' EP way back in 2011, he has since gone on to spearhead a new movement of musicians in the Midlands  under the moniker of Concrete Collective. For his sophomore effort, he returns to explore similar themes to his first release through his richly emotive compositions.

'Sanctum' opens with rain-soaked atmospherics and melancholy chords interwoven with an intricate 2-step rhythm. A powerful bassline punches through with raw emotion, pushing the track further into the stratosphere.

On the digital flip, Birmingham-based brothers Rough Frequencies up the tempo to deliver a classic slice of liquid D&B. Sparkling melodies descend across rolling beats and cavernous bass for a late-night roller of distinction.

Tracklisting:

01. Sanctum (Original Mix)
02. Sanctum (Rough Frequencies Mix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F5492607&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F5492607&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Materia - Atlas
description:
We wish a welcome return to the imprint for Swedish producer Materia, who has crafted 'Atlas', an album that extrapolates the fundamentals of house, garage, dubstep and techno - then fuses them into a listening experience full of warmth and texture which reveals further depths through every repeated play.

'Otherland' is the opening statement of intent. Windswept and widescreen, it's cinematic qualities are pushed to the fore from the outset with melancholy chords drenched over skeletal percussion. The mood intensifies as the ice-cold beat drops and the track draws you slowly under its spell.

'Clouds' sees a collaboration with NYC vocalist Winter and UK lyricist Koast. Over a narcotic half-step rhythm, Koast delivers a heartfelt paean to hedonism taking its toll, whilst Winter adds her gossamer voice to proceedings, elevating the track into something solemn yet beautiful.

'Grounded' evokes hazy summer nights spent in a neon-soaked metropolis, as live strings, guitar and brass coalesce into a laidback groove that exudes a rich sensuality.

'Shallow Waters' goes south of the equator and turns the tempo up for a rolling house cut with live Rhodes and flute in a playful interchange. 

'Shadows' finds cavernous space in dubwise rhythms, with a booming sub-bass strapped to skittering beats and emotive chords.

'Headspace' combines dub and techno textures with startling results, offering up an expansive galaxy of spectral sound to drift into.

'Skylight' sees the return of songstress Winter to add sugar-sweet vocal textures over a gorgeous drum & bass rhythm that is full to the brim with sunshine.

'Downstream' draws the listener down deep into a seductive house groove with live saxophone played with a mischievous touch by Startslow. 

'Ruins' is a joint composition between Materia and the highly-regarded Bristol producer Forsaken, who combine for an atmospheric slow house jam with a moody energy all its own.

'Synthesis' completes the journey with a grand flourish, delving into tech-house territory for an epic nine minute excursion into interstellar rhythms that takes you off the edge of the world into ecstasy.

01.Otherland [8:35]
02.Clouds (featuring Koast & Winter) [4:59]
03.Grounded (featuring Justin Lewis) [4:55]
04.Shallow Waters (featuring Ben Wood & Paul Quinn) [7:21]
05.Shadows [7:19]
06.Headspace [7:04]
07.Skylight (featuring Winter & Startslow) [7:20]
08.Downstream (featuring Startslow) [5:26]
09.Ruins (featuring Forsaken) [4:40]
10.Synthesis [9:13]

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722574&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722574&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Latcha - Invisible
description:
Slime welcomes UK producer Latcha to the label after a string of impressive appearances on imprints such as Immersed Audio and Loft Party. Merging house, garage and dubstep into a heady brew of bass music, Latcha exudes confidence in his  production style, as evidenced by this accomplished release.

'Viable' is executed with clinical precision, building up over a extended pattern of dark beatwork before rolling basslines and reversed FX join the party to decimate any dancefloor. 

'Call It That' takes things deeper with a hazy slice of late night vibes, chords oscillating in the mix with a lightness of touch that propels the beat forward with ease.

Tracklisting:

01. Viable
02. Call It That

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722520&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722520&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Semiotics - Moda
description:
The next release on Slime sees us head back to the UK to welcome Guildford-based DJ & producer Semiotics to the label. As one of the heads behind the Wizard Sleeve collective, he is at the forefront in showcasing the most cutting-edge music around, both on their blog and in their live shows. This exposure has bled into his own work, and here he delivers an impressive debut of emotive electronic music with flair and depth.

'Moda' floats in on plucked strings, wistful vocals and a staccato beat before affirming itself with a heavy bassline and snapping percussion that draws you in deep.

'Chrysalis' twists guitar and bass around a serpentine framework of clicks and kicks that seems always on the verge of collapse but coalesces with a feather-light touch to triumphantly pull the listener skywards.

'Enveloped' builds a tight groove around reversing chords and echoing keys, plaintive melodies haunting along the structure that hint at hidden depths.

'Leaves' drops the tempo down by a half-step for a horizontal excursion through glittering bells and slow motion bassweight that will soothe even the weariest head.

Tracklisting:

01. Moda
02. Chrysalis
03. Enveloped
04. Leaves

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722504&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722504&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Drual - Ritual
description:
Slime returns to Russia for a second helping of the new wave of electronic artists emerging from the former Soviet bloc. This time it's the turn of Drual, whose emotive and playful take on electronica marked him out immediately as a perfect fit for the imprint.

'Ritual' kicks off with a tropical rhythm that is quickly inverted into bucolic melodies and scattershot percussion. Slow waves of euphoria descend into the mix, with melancholy chords providing a beautiful juxtaposition to the frenetic beatwork.

'Void Player' packs a whole lot of invention into its short running time, with trembling notes fed through the prism of dubstep resulting in brand new forms.

'Vutrobe' extrapolates the pastoral enchantment of Boards Of Canada and re-configures it into something haunting.

Tracklisting:

01. Ritual
02. Void Player
03. Vutrobe

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722482&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4722482&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Groofeo - Hybrid
description:
Slime welcomes Russian artist Groofeo to the label with a release that draws on elements of dubstep, autonomic and electronica to create inventive sonic textures.

'Outside The Earth' orbits around lush pads and a skeletal autonomic beat that puts the listener under its spell from the outset.

' Synchrophasotron ' expands the sound into a halfstep rhythm with cavernous depth.

'Melancholy' switches gears once again with a woozy breakbeat and a laidback jazz melody strapped to soulful vocals for a narcotic late-night jam.

Tracklisting:

01. Outside The Earth
02. Synchrophasotron
03. Melancholy

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4697785&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4697785&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: DJ Blakey - Making Time
description:
Slime welcomes the return of DJ Blakey to the label. Previous releases 'If You See Me' and 'A New Chapter' cemented his reputation with those in the know as the go-to guy for classic garage vibes. For this third release on the imprint, he returns with another superb slice of good times backed up with a stellar D&B mix from Ram Recordings luminary Basher.

'Making Time' rolls in on a summertime groove of laidback 4/4 and breathless vocals. Warm pads and bumpy percussion intertwine a serpentine bassline with dynamic results. This is a pure sunshine roller.

On the digital flip, Basher drops an intricate reworking of the original into a liquid classic in the making. Straight up peak-time ammunition if ever we heard it.

Tracklisting:

01. Making Time (Original Mix)
02. Making Time (Basher Mix)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4390786&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4390786&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Deuperium - Telemetry
description:
The mysterious Deuperium makes his debut on the label with four very different takes on the majesty of acid house. 

'Together' packs a emotive punch from the start with melancholy keys and a bubbling bassline grafted to a heavy acid workout for maximum effect.

'Galaxy News' rolls in on a downbeat style, with warm pads laid under simple snaps of percussion and constantly evolving melodies.

'Why Not' strips back the beat for a classic warehouse stomp that will be a staple floorfiller for any discerning jackers.

'XOX Acid' drops the tempo way down low for a slow motion odyssey into acid.

Tracklisting:

01. Together
02. Galaxy News
03. Why Not
04. XOX Acid

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4048937&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4048937&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: SPD - The Way We Live
description:
SPD returns to the label after providing one of it's stand-out releases from last year in 'Tunwan', which garnered praise from such luminaries as Phaeleh. For his sophomore effort, the Liverpool-based producer delivers another masterclass in emotive electronic music with bite.

'Habitus' picks apart the skeleton of his previous work and re-animates it into strange and brilliant new forms. 

'Simulacrum' infuses a slow motion house beat with laconic chords and spoken-word samples to dynamic effect. 

'Heldhands' extrapolates the garage template into a glittering new world with oscillating keys and warm chords strapped across the back of a percussive juggernaut.

'Street Flutters' drifts into being through a cloud of atmospheric ambience and subtle textures before taking flight into a midnight masterpiece of laidback grooves.

Tracklisting:

01. Habitus
02. Simulacrum
03. Heldhands
04. Street Flutters

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4048892&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4048892&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Seagram Murals - Albion
description:
Slime welcomes Australian producer Seagram Murals to the label for an astonishing foray into the depths of electronica. Drawing from the best elements of the genre's palette, his music is invested with a warmth, dynamism and personality all of it's own that has won him praise from artists such as Tycho.

The six songs presented here form a cohesive whole that brings you under it's spell from the first notes. 'Dawn' sets the tone with a melancholy ambience that is extrapolated into bright new shapes through 'Veritas', before taking flight into 'Albion', saturated in choral echoes and playful melodies. 'Unicorn' unravels the narrative with a subtle twist, circuit-bent strings and stuttering percussion cascading into the consciousness of 'Addled', drenched in a skewed array of chords that becomes a companion to the haunting overtones of 'Tapping' which takes the experience full circle.

Tracklisting:

01. Dawn
02. Veritas
03. Albion
04. Unicorn
05. Addled
06. Tapping

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4048626&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F4048626&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Monika - Devotion
description:
Monika makes his debut on Slime with a double slice of mouth-watering bass music, full to the brim with emotion and atmosphere.

'Devotion' rolls in on tribal chants wrapped in an autonomic exoskeleton. Swooning chords drift across the landscape before the structure evolves into a woozy halfstep, complete with cavernous bass and subtle atmospherics.

'No Air (Breathe)' has a sharp strand of gossamer melody running through its core that entwines with breathless vocals and stuttering percussion to devastating effect. Layer after layer of chords adds to the impact until you are consumed by it's passion.

Tracklisting:

01. Devotion
02. No Air (Breathe)

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F3685559&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F3685559&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Retrospekt - Popularity
description:
Retrospekt returns to the label after his house anthem 'Rolling' stole the show on dancefloors across the world last year. For his sophomore offering, he delivers two more trademark slow motion house cuts full to the brim of personality and warmth.

'Popularity' drops a cheeky vintage sample over a laconic house groove that draws you under its spell with ease. Subtle pads and a deep bassline add to the magic to make this track an essential late night jam.

'Get It' brings things bang up to date with a splash of neon-flecked atmospherics suffused to a glacial polyrhythm. A sharp and brilliant bass tone underpins the whole show whilst the chords get busy making this joint fresh to death.

01. Popularity
02. Get It

<object height="18" width="100%"> <param name="movie" value="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F3584584&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727"></param> <param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param> <param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed wmode="transparent" allowscriptaccess="always" height="18" src="https://player.soundcloud.com/player.swf?url=http%3A%2F%2Fapi.soundcloud.com%2Fplaylists%2F3584584&auto_play=false&player_type=tiny&font=Arial&color=272727" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" width="100%"></embed> </object>

name: Physik - Younger Days
description:
Physik steps up to the plate for his debut on Slime, delivering a deadly twin attack of deep garage and crisp breakbeat.

'Younger Days' floats in on hazy chords and warm strings before the soulful vocal refrain sweeps in to kick-start proceedings with a flowing 2-step rhythm and speaker-freaking bassweight. 

'Torn Apart' amps up the atmosphere with cinematic flourish, dubwise samples and a heavy breakbeat adding some serious crunch to the texture of this track.

Tracklisting:

01. Younger Days
02. Torn Apart

name: Hybu - Duck Hunt
description:
Hybu makes a welcome return to the label, having delivered some of the most forward-thinking bass music on the imprint over the past few years. For his next trick, he drops this much-anticipated dancefloor thriller.

'Duck Hunt' blends garage, soca and rave with explosive results. Proving that sometimes simplicity is the most direct path to dancefloor devastation, this brutally efficient bleep array strapped to a tropical rhythm does the damage with ease. You have been warned!

First up on the remix tip, blnd! twists the original into an undulating creature of a tune, with sticky tendrils poking around seductively in halfstep, garage and techno. Plot Twist then drops a sensual re-lick of R&B stylings drizzled over juke rhythms creating something truly spicy in the process. Finally, Heblank opts for an old school house flavour, combining rave stabs and heavy percussion to elevate this track to the status of a warehouse classic.

Tracklisting : 

01. Duck Hunt (Original Mix)
02. Duck Hunt (blnd! Mix)
03. Duck Hunt (Plot Twist Mix)
04. Duck Hunt (Heblank Mix)

name: Pledge - Waiting
description:
Slime welcomes Pledge to the imprint, coming to us with a pedigree of releases on labels such as L2S and Bass Machine. Here he delivers an EP with two very distinctive garage flavours, cementing his reputation as one to watch on the UKG scene.

'Waiting' rolls in on a wave of emotion, melancholy pads fused to a shuffling garage beat that creates an atmospheric experience. Distant chords sparkle in the mix with soft vocals gliding over the surface adding depth and warmth to proceedings.

'Back To The Future' flips the script entirely with a peak-time ride to the dark side, classic garage in the making with a retro bassline and brooding FX to match the mood. Drop this on a dance and watch them wind it up!

Slime alumni Pickha reworks the lead track into a deep delight, old school piano keys washing over ethereal vocals for a sublime journey back through time to the golden age of house music.

Tracklisting:

01. Waiting
02. Back To The Future
03. Waiting (Pikcha Mix)

name: Aleks Zen - Sweet & Sour
description:
Aleks Zen is something of a renaissance man on the rise - producer, singer, DJ, MC... the list goes on. For his debut release on Slime however he strips it back to the bare essentials with two deceptively simple yet beguiling house tracks that are packed full of pure sunshine.

'Transcend & Unity' combines retro house and bass music with intoxicating results, warm pads and a simple kickdrum the driving force pushing the track forward. A subtle pulse of bass works it's way along the spine of the rhythm, constantly mutating underneath female vocal cuts and glittering keys.

'Unrequited Lust' switches things up with a monstrous bass groove that will have many a clubber pinned to the dancefloor for it's duration. A certain well-known vocal cut gets expertly deployed across the track whilst spiralling melodies are deftly interwoven with cinematic strings to make this a must-have for the discerning DJ's digital crate.

Tracklisting:

01. Transcend & Unity
02. Unrequited Lust

name: BSN Posse - Love History
description:
BSN Posse return to Slime after their celebrated debut 'Songs From The Sea' hit the label last year.

The Spanish production team have conjured up another sensual confection for their second offering with the beautiful 'Love History', backed with a selection of remixes from some of the brightest young names on the bass music circuit.

The original is a heady brew of breathless female vocals strewn across a delicate halfstep rhythm. Warmth penetrates the track like rays of pure sunshine, five minutes of suspended time that is eternally summer.

Laney kicks of the remix package with a playful extrapolation of the more seductive elements of the original, strapping it to a future-proof rhythm for maximum impact. Sker opts for a more ambient structure, chords low and loose in the mix with a glimmering autonomic finish. Mr Beeb switches things up a gear for a classic garage shuffle that is packed full of swing. Manul goes straight for the jugular with his interpretation, dubstep rhythms suffused with jungle flourishes and a four to the floor finish that will leave you breathless. Lojt takes it down a notch, combining the warmth of the original with a feel-good house groove that is sheer perfection. Finally, Elias Smith offers up a take that comes on like a long lost rave anthem with piano stabs and skittering beats played over warm chords and rolling bass.

Tracklisting:

01. Love History (Original Mix)
02. Love History (Laney Mix)
03. Love History (Sker Mix)
04. Love History (Mr Beeb Mix)
05. Love History (Manul Mix)
06. Love History (Lojt Mix)
07. Love History (Elias Smith Mix)

name: Neue Grafik - Verdana
description:
Slime welcomes Parisian producer Neue Grafik to the label with a debut packed full of emotion and invention. Raw bass music infused with a psychedelic twist, the 'Verdana' EP combines acrobatic beats over haunting flourishes of melody. 

'Verdana' drifts into being with wistful vocals reverberating through stuttering percussion. Melodies intertwine and elevate the track higher as a steady pulse of bass underpins the entire structure.

'Bauhaus' draws deep with reversed synths and tweaks the R&B playbook with tantalizing slices of drunken keys that is pure sensual seduction.

Tracklisting:

01. Verdana
02. Bauhaus

name: Voice Hands Machine - Cold Jam
description:
Slime returns to blaze a trail with a new artist to the label in the form of Voice Hands Machine.

Founded by former DMC Scratch Champion DJ Kodh, the Parisian producer comes to the imprint after a string of impressive releases that combine skewed pop sensibilities with finely-tuned electronica, recalling the refined sounds of Hot Chip, Schneider TM and Bitpixel. 

'Cold Jam' is a pitch-perfect pop song armed with a beguiling melodic touch and gossamer electronica flourishes that will capture your heart. Kodh drops an original vocal across the whole track as spiralling synths elevate the song higher with every play.

Finnish production duo Jack The Hustler rework the track with the vocals pitched up and a booming percussive exoskeleton that will make many a soundsystem sweat.

Fellow Parisians mad:AM provide the final remix, turning in a soulful house epic that retains the melody of the original and straps it to a deep and mellow rhythm that is packed full of sunshine.

Tracklisting:

01. Cold Jam (Original Mix)
02. Cold Jam (Jack The Hustler Mix)
03. Cold Jam (mad:AM Mix)
04. Cold Jam (Radio Edit)

name: DJ Blakey - A New Chapter
description:
Slime starts the year in style with a brand new selection from former DMC champion DJ Blakey.

Blakey debuted his flawless production style on the label last year with the 'If You See Me' EP, much loved by garage fans across the world. Not to be outdone for his second release, 'A New Chapter' features four tracks of immaculate garage, smooth house and bumpy techno that will enrapture discerning dancefloors everywhere.

'Little Bear' comes correct with some serious old skool swing backed up by descending melodic interplay and shuffling percussion.

'Got Myself' spikes the formula with piano stabs and jacking beats for a downtown Chicago feel.

'Detour' does just that and takes us into minimal techno territory with swirling FX underpinning a relentless groove.

'Out Of Nowhere' drops the bass low and loud for a percussion-crazed tech-house hybrid packed with finesse.

01. Little Bear
02. Got Myself
03. Detour
04. Out Of Nowhere
